STATE OF MICHIGAN
GRETCHEN WHITMER DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR LANSING DIRECTOR
June 13, 2022
Mary Jo French
Muskegon County Juvenile Transition Center
205 E. Apple
Muskegon, MI 49442
RE: License #: CO610385814
Muskegon County Juvenile Transition Center
205 E. Apple
Muskegon, MI 49442
Dear Ms. French:
This letter is a follow-up to the Department’s findings regarding the interim inspection
conducted at your facility on 06/09/2022. The purpose of this inspection was to determine
compliance with applicable licensing statutes and administrative rules for Court Operated
Residential Care Facility.
Your facility was found to be in compliance with the requirements of Licensing Rules for
Juvenile Court Operated Facilities.
An onsite tour was completed on 06/13/2022. The facility was observed to be clean and
well maintained. Ample staff were present and observed to be supervising the residents.
This consultant viewed all the pod areas where the youth are residing, and it was
observed to be clean and well maintained. Residents were attending their onsite
schooling during the tour.
During interviews staff reported feeling both staff and residents are safe at the facility and
supervision is provided as required. Staff expressed frustration with having a difficult
youth on the unit that has more mental health needs and not always knowing what will
trigger a youth to have escalated behaviors. During interviews with residents, they
indicated they enjoy the food that is being provided at the facility and the staff treat them
with respect. Residents reported feeling safe at the facility. Residents noted they wanted
to be able to listen to their own choice of music instead of just instrumental music. Staff
reported the concerns that youth listen to inappropriate music that have swear words and
talk about violence. Both staff and residents interviewed stated residents are only
restrained after staff have attempted to verbally deescalate the situation first and is used

as a last resort. Neither staff nor residents indicated concerns with restraints they
observed or participated in.
Technical assistance was provided to the administration team of making sure the staff
have role clarity as they expressed frustration on some new roles that have been
implemented on the unit. It was also discussed about helping staff understand the mental
health needs of the youth and having clear communication about how to help support
those youth. This consultant discussed the increase in restraint numbers being solely due
to one youth based on the high mental health needs and trauma the youth experienced.
The facility has maintained appropriate communication about the needs of this youth and
what steps are being taken to make sure this youth is being transitioned into the next
appropriate program. Consultation was provided about the treatment program, as it is not
currently being used. The facility is looking at the potential options of changing the
treatment program to meet the community’s needs.
Please contact me with any questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need
to speak to someone immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica
VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant
June 13, 2022
Jessica VandenHeuvel, Area Manager
